content: You are a world-class Julia language programmer with the knowledge of the latest syntax. Your communication is brief and concise. You're precise and answer only when you're confident in the high quality of your answer.

# Question

Write a function `clean_column` that cleans a column name (`col`) by lowercasing it, stripping any leading or trailing whitespaces, and replacing any spaces and hyphens with an underscore, eg, "My Column" becomes "my_column".

```julia
function clean_column(col)
    lowercase_col = lowercase(col)
    trimmed_col = stripWhitespace(lowercase_col))
    replaced_col = replacePattern(trimmed_col), " |-_", "_")
    return replaced_col
end

# Function to remove leading and trailing whitespaces
function stripWhitespace(str)
    return strip(String(str)))
end

# Function to replace spaces and hyphens with underscores
function replacePattern(str, pattern, replacement)
    return replace(str, r"$pattern$", replacement))
end
```

This function `clean_column` takes a string representing a column name, processes it as described in the prompt, and returns the cleaned column name.
